title: analyst
pros: Great learning experience and work environment
cons: honestly no cons just potentially longer hours

title: Review
pros: Exposure to complex deals across all asset classes.
cons: Only get to work with one small deal team.

title: Don’t say you were not warned
pros: Decent comp and benefits, good ERP system, diverse investment strategy
cons: I can only opine on the acctg dept. Toxic work culture. Very high turnover. Lots of politics and favoritism. No room for growth unless you kiss up and give your life to the company. CEO barely shows face and wants people in office. CFO is very difficult to work for. She lacks leadership skills and EQ and cultivates a terrible culture. She isn’t a parent so she doesn’t understand or respect working parents. HR is not to be trusted and everyone knows it. They only look out for sr mgmt and themselves. It’s every man for themselves at this company. No team environment - quite depressing. Stay clear of this place. There are much better companies in south Florida to choose from and this is NOT one of them.

title: Analyst
pros: Lots of volume in the right groups.
cons: Not a great experience if you’re in the servicing groups

title: Great Company
pros: Flexible, great team not much driving around and balance work life
cons: If you're not an office body this is not the job for you, very fast pace

title: Great place to learn
pros: Well rounded exposure to different parts of the real estate industry Everyone is willing to help you learn/grow
cons: Corporate atmosphere which can get old after a while

title: Great community environment
pros: This is by far one of the best places I've ever worked.
cons: The Miami Beach office coulb be a pain to get to during rush hour traffic

title: Great Place To Learn
pros: LNR is an excellent place to learn a lot in a short period of time. Skills are highly transferable. The company attracts incredible talent, which typically stays between two to four years before moving on. You will make good business contacts while you are there.
cons: Be prepared to work long hours with lots of fire drills and receive little or no recognition. The culture is very corporate and bureaucratic, and the pay is mediocre considering the relatively high cost of living in Miami. The company lacks leadership and fails to provide meaningful communication to employees.

title: LNR is a dynamic workplace
pros: LNR has a wide range of positions related to commercial real estate finance. The company has focused on Special Servicing of CMBS loans and related investments, but has grown significantly after being purchased by Starwood. The business includes commerical loan origination, servicing and direct real estate investments. LNR offers excellent benefits and competitive pay. Organizational leaders are smart and professional.
cons: The workload can be too much at times. Managers are supportive but there is always a call to do more with less.

title: Great place to learn
pros: There is opportunity but a lot has to do with timing and how much of your personal time you are willing to commit to learn and grow.
cons: Not much of a team environment. Everyone works independently and not as a unit. Work/life balance is nonexistent if you want to move up here.

title: Good Place to Learn
pros: Good training particularly for rotational analysts. Decent pay and benefits. Mostly good people to work with. Good place to get a lot of exposure to real estate.
cons: Some horrible managers that the company will not fire for whatever reason. Performance review system that affects your bonus is completely subjective based on your manager’s opinion of you.

title: Better than Disney Rollercoaster
pros: Many team members have been with the company for over a decade. There is concern for the well being of the staff whether thru benefit education, wellness fairs, holiday early departures.
cons: Work / Life Balance could be better.

title: Investor Reporting Analyst
pros: Competitive salary, decent benefits, many subsidies & discounts, yoga classes on-site
cons: No work/lie balance, middle management lacks direction & organization, no clear defined roles & responsibilities, unrealistic expectations, lack of appreciation,

title: Corporate America?
pros: Lots of resources, good coffee, ok pay, diversity of departments to get exposure to.
cons: Extremely strong office politics, somewhat arrogant employees, tendency for management to reward obedience and punish curiosity.

title: Hot and cold
pros: - smart people - creative financing - good training
cons: - hostile atmosphere at times - lack of care for employees - rumors and politicking encouraged

title: Review - September 21, 2015
pros: The company is good at CMBS Special Servicing, and is increasing its investment in Conduit Loans.
cons: Communication from upper management and Asset Managers to loan servicing is not as good as it should be.

title: It was a good company very corporate
pros: People were decent to work with, pay was good
cons: Hard to get a raise. So make sure you ask for what you want upfront

title: Good
pros: Office located near lots of restaurants. Balance of young professionals and senior managers. Great learning experience.
cons: Tasks are sometimes very repetitive and robotic.

title: Realestate Specialist
pros: Great company, learn a great deal, met awesome co workers and enjoyed of the companies great location.
cons: Not a lot of opportunity of advancement

title: OK, good experience but plently of downsides
pros: Good Experience and lots of learning about commercial real estate
cons: lack of communication from senior management

title: Rotational Analyst
pros: Great office environment, job allows you to be a part of multiple departments throughout the company
cons: No cons. Great company to work in.

title: Great Company
pros: Loved working there, great company. Analyst rotational program provided great introduction to real estate investing.
cons: Nothing bad to say, great company.

title: Good company.
pros: A great learning experience from working with many different types of systems.
cons: Lack of training, lack of communication with upper management.

title: Good company
pros: Very competitive, pragmatic and fast paced environment.
cons: New building is still under construction.

title: System Admin
pros: Competitive compensations compared to other companies in South Florida
cons: Traffic in and out of South Beach is the worse, poor management

title: Great Place to Work At

title: Great Company

cons: Location of corporate office was the only downside

title: Great company

title: Great Company With Great People

title: Great resume builder, not long term
